input2:
Patient was seen in clinic and was found to be tachycardic with HR 107, but with significant epigastric tenderness and mild rebound. She describes the pain as a tightness that is constant and does not go away . It is rated a ___. She denies any worsening with food/drink. She denies vomiting/diarrhea, her last bm was 2pm. Denies any blood or melena.  Of note, patient has been taking her prednisone as scheduled (7.5mg daily) but has not increased the dose.  Patient has chronic leukocytosis upon review of OMR.  In the ED, initial vitals were: 98 94 142/90 18 98% RA  
 - Labs were significant for WBC 20.4, H/H ___, Plt 461, NA 129, K 3.2, Cr 1.1, normal LFTs and lipase. Normal coags. Lactate 2.5  
 - Imaging revealed: RUQ notable for steatosis but no etiology for abdominal pain.  
 - The patient was given: 2L NS, Morphine Sulfate 2mg x1, Zofran 4mg x1, Hydrocot 100mg x1, KCl 40mEq, Pantoprazole 40mg IV x1  
 - Upon arrival to the floor, patient reports feeling improved from when she arrived in the ED. She reports chronic abdominal pain, denies current nausea, fevers, chills, sweats. Reports mild dysuria.
